metadata.title: CVE-2019-2213 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
In binder_free_transaction of binder.c, there is a possible use-after-freedue to a race condition. This could lead to local escalation of privilegewith no additional execution privileges needed. User interaction is notneeded for exploitation.Product: AndroidVersions: Android kernelAndroid ID:A-133758011References: Upstream kernel

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-2213` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1059-azure - 4.15.0-1059.64~14.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'was needed ESM criteria').
linux-lts-xenial: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'was needed ESM criteria').
linux-aws: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'was needed ESM criteria').
linux-azure package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1059.64~14.04.1').
